items.text: length ball on middle, that Gayle comfortably tucks away to the leg side
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Gayle, no run

items.text: quick length ball that goes down the leg side, but only just. Gayle tried to nudge it square, but misses. He smiles, because the umpire doesn't call it a wide
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Gayle, no run

items.text: length ball on off again, and Gayle taps it to mid on and races off (yes, races off) for a single
full on middle, and defended straight back to Fizz off the front foot
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Hope, no run

items.preText: Ryan Sojib: "Today I was checking the weather forecast of St Kitts, guess what? There was a prediction of Gayle-storm! "
items.text: length ball on off, and he defends it away to cover on this occasion
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Hope, no run

items.text: full on middle, and he gets inside the line of the ball to drive. Pushes to mid on eventually
items.postText: SarfBD: "Bangladesh management has a predetermined idea that left handed batsmen can't play offspinners and left arm bowler can't bowl well against them. Even when thinks don't work, they believe this like a superstition. Otherwise why instead of using front line bowlers, they are using part timers when Gayle is quite comfortable sending them out of the ground?"
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Hope, no run

items.text: stand and deliver! Half-tracker outside off from the bowler, and Gayle goes onto the back foot, and pulls this over cow corner
items.postText: Aj: "Not sure Hope is suited to colored clothing cricket "

items.text: out of the ground! Lands in the city of Basseterre. Overpitched on middle, and Gayle opens his chest and thumps this over long on. New balls please!

items.preText: Jigar Aiya: "Mantra to get bowling today.. Your name should start with "M" Only Mushi left now..any chance?" -- Haha, even Sarfraz bowled two overs against Zimbabwe in their 5th ODI. You never know...
items.text: good length outside off, and that's been left alone
slower through the air, and this lands outside off. Skids through and Gayle needs to adjust late onto his back foot. Eventually splices this to mid on
length ball outside off, and skidding through again. Hope misses the cut
full just outside off, and driven down the ground to long on
items.postText: Ram: "Hello Sreshth, Can you tell me which channel live telecasts this match in India?" -- Hey, you can watch it on SONY ESPN on your television, or watch on ESPN.in

items.text: full just outside off, and he dabs this late to third man for a walking single
good length outside off, and he cuts it late to third man once again. Gayle walks across for one
full just outside off, and driven with the angled bat to deep point. Just a single though
full on off, and he defends with soft hands
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Gayle, no run

items.text: full on leg, and he clips it away to deep midwicket for a single. Awry throw from the deep, but Mahmudullah's backing up
full on middle, and defended to the off side. He wants a single, but point intercepts
items.postText: Pratik: "Chris Gayle equals Afridi with 476 international sixes!! I hope this record doesn't go unnoticed. Unlikely to be beaten"
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Hope, no run

items.text: full on off, but angling across Gayle. He sticks his bat out and the ball goes just past his outside edge! So close
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Gayle, no run

items.preText: Shimul Haque: "i'm from mushi's university. He was a regular bowler, bowling offspin in university contests."
items.text: back of a length delivery that cramps Gayle for space. Defends it away to the off side rather uncomfortably
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Gayle, no run

items.text: full on middle and leg. Gayle comes forward and defends
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Gayle, no run

items.text: full outside off, and he runs this cut down to third man for a jogging single
good length outside off, and Hope gets onto the back foot, for a punch back to cover
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Hope, no run

items.preText: asQ: "Hey Sreshth, can you tell me the music they are using during highlights?" No idea, but I love the tune too. If any of our readers know the answer, please write in! I could do with some background music to my life too.
items.text: full just outside off, and defended
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Hope, no run

items.text: overpitched on middle, and Gayle has no trouble in whipping this away to deep square leg for a single. Partnership of 50 (in 60 balls)
